qas.question: What % of households were spending less than £20 per week in 2004
What % of the population claimed social security benefits in 2006/7?
How much of the population is over age 60?

context: Household survey results suggest the percentage of households spending less than £20 per week on a per capita basis fell from 27% to <a0_0>8%<a0_0/> between 2000 and 2004, implying a decline in income poverty. Nevertheless, <a1_0>22<a1_0/>% of the population claimed social security benefit in 2006/7, most of them aged over 60, a sector that represents <a2_0>20%<a2_0/> of the population.
